newsitem.title: USA: ZAPATA SAYS STILL WANTS ENVIRODYNE.
newsitem.headline: ZAPATA SAYS STILL WANTS ENVIRODYNE.

text.p: Zapata Corp on Wednesday reiterated its interest in buying the rest of Envirodyne Industries Inc and urged the firm to put itself on the block.

The expression came after Envirodyne earlier this week received an $8.50 per share takeover offer from investment firm Heico Holdings Inc. The company is affiliated with Michael Heisley, one of Envirodyne's directors.

"Zapata will only support a sales process in which a level playing field is established for all potential bidders. Under these circumstances, Zapata would make an offer to purchase Envirodyne," Zapata President Avram Glazer wrote in a letter to Envirodyne President Edward Gustafson.
Zapata is Envirodyne's largest stockholder, with a 40 percent stake. Envirodyne is a food packaging company.

Zapata, which produces oil, natural gas and fish meal, has been struggling with Envirodyne for months and unsuccessfully tried to install its own slate of directors to the Envirodyne board. In May, it offered to buy Envirodyne for $8 per share.
Shares of Envirodyne were unchanged at $8 in early trading. Zapata stock also was unchanged at $6 per share.
